snippet: Federal authorities plan to issue a stinging critique of how banking regulators responded to wide-ranging foreclosure abuses, blaming officials for a bureaucratic maze that delayed relief to homeowners.
abstract: Federal authorities plan to issue a stinging critique of how banking regulators responded to wide-ranging foreclosure abuses, blaming officials for a bureaucratic maze that delayed relief to homeowners.

byline.original: By JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG and BEN PROTESS

headline.main: Government Watchdog Faults Regulators Over Foreclosure Review

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency
